about_the_game:
Welcome to Cortex Protocol test subject ███████!

In this VR game you will be navigating through a maze in a computer simulation. The mazes are filled with puzzles and traps, and come in different shapes and sizes. In these mazes you have full control over the position of rooms, you can rotate parts of the maze just like you would rotate a Rubik’s cube. Your testing assignment will be to navigate to the exit of these mazes.


Here at Cortex we test the capabilities of the human mind, your contribution will help us make a better future.

We hope that you have a pleasant testing experience.

Best regards,

Dr. █████████████
PR-04, Public Relations Officer
█████████@██████████

The Demo features:


  • 6 cube shaped levels, consisting of rooms, traps and locked doors.
  • The ability to turn the cube similar to a Rubik’s Cube, every side or pivot can be rotated in two directions. Rotation will also influence the orientation of the traps and the gravity in relation to the player.
  • 3 types of traps: lasers, turrets and blenders
  • 2 types of puzzles, big- and small pressure plates
  • Time Trial: Can you break your record for completing the level? Compare your time to your friends and see who is the quickest.

short_description: Cortex protocol is a puzzle oriented VR game, where you have to clear interesting mazes shaped like Rubik’s Cubes. Learn to think outside of the box by rotating the maze in order to find the exit while avoiding deadly traps and solving puzzles. All in the name of science!
